subject: Procedure for referring the decision of DRE/DRB to Arbitration.
text: HTf4 <rcfly <TATf grfeahror Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (7a 4a6t, 737 TRar7 31< TTTTHT TTTTT) Extn 2223/2318/2468/2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/21/2002-Admn: February 18, 2005 POLICY MATTER 1 ADMINISTRATIONIFINANCE (99/2005) (Decision taken on File No. NHAIIDR&QA CellARB/2005 dated 24.01.2005) Sub: Procedure for referring the decisions of DREIDRB to Arbitration: It has been decided that the matter about referring the decisions of Dispute Review Expert (DRE) / Dispute Review Board (DRB) to Arbitration may be reviewed by a committee  before    proceeding for Arbitration: The committee   consisting of  following officials shall be constituted to look into the above aspects 1_ Member of the Concerned Zone in which the DREIDRB decision falls. 2 Member (Finance) 3_ Member CGM of any ther Technical Zone. The Committee will examine the matter and recommend whether the decision of DREIDRB is   acceptable on merits. On the basis of the recommendation of the Committee it will be decided whether matter needs to be referred further to Arbitration or not. It will be the responsibility of the concerned technical division to submit the matter to the above Committee within the period of Iimitation so that the cases are not barred for approaching the court of law or for arbitration: Since the decisions of DREIDRB have to be appealed against within a prescribed time limit, as provided in the contract agreement for referring to the Arbitration, these meetings should be held in time and decision on these issues should not be delayed on this account. It has also been decided that if Chairman is out of office on tour Or on any account; action should be taken as per the recommendations of the Committee_ Approval of Chairman may be obtained subsequently. All concerned may please note for information and strict compliance: This issues with the approval of the Chairman: (G.P.
